channel.title: Anna Leander on
channel.description: Recent content in Anna Leander on

item.title: Dependency Today-Finance, Firms, Mafias and the State: A Review of Susan Strange's Work from a Developing Country Perspective
item.description: Leander, Anna. “Dependency Today-Finance, Firms, Mafias and the State: A Review of Susan Strangeâ€™s Work from a Developing Country Perspective.” Third World Quarterly 22, no. 1 (2001): 115-128. This is an analysis of how the global strategies of Multi-national Enterprises (MNE’s) affect the power relationship between MNE’s and states in the context of increasing trans-national economic integration. Keywords: Money and Finance; Trade; Structural Power, Power; Economic Development Text access (external link)

item.title: Strange Looks on Developing Countries: A Neglected Kaleidoscope of Questions
item.description: Leander, Anna. “Strange Looks on Developing Countries: A Neglected Kaleidoscope of Questions.” In Strange Power: Shaping the Parameters of International Relations and International Political Economy, edited by Thomas Lawton, James Rosenau, Amy C. Verdun, 343-365. London: Routledge, 2000. Keywords: Political Economy; Developing Countries Text access (external link)
